story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled between a lush green forest and a sparkling river, lived a kind and curious boy named Ahmad. Ahmad was a wonderful son and a respectful student. He always helped his mother with the household chores and listened attentively to his teachers. His favorite time of the day was when his mother would tell him stories from the Quran before he went to bed.

One day, Ahmad asked his mother, "Mother, why do we pray to Allah five times a day?" His mother smiled and replied, "My dear Ahmad, prayer is our way of communicating with Allah and showing our gratitude for all the blessings He has bestowed upon us. It is a time for us to reflect on our actions, seek forgiveness for our mistakes, and ask for His guidance."

Ahmad thought for a moment and then asked, "But mother, how do we know that Allah is listening to our prayers?" His mother, with a twinkle in her eye, said, "Ahmad, Allah is always listening, even when we don't realize it. He knows what is in our hearts and what we truly need. But, my dear, there is a story in the Quran that will help you understand this better."

Ahmad snuggled closer to his mother, eager to hear the story. His mother began, "Once, there was a prophet named Zakariya, who was a devoted servant of Allah. He was also a very old man, and his wife was barren. But despite their old age, they always prayed to Allah for a child, as they longed to have a child to carry on the Prophet's mission.

One day, while Prophet Zakariya was praying in the mihrab (a prayer niche), an angel appeared before him. The angel said, 'Allah has heard your prayer. Your wife will give birth to a son, and you will name him Yahya (John). He will be a righteous servant of Allah, and he will prepare the way for a prophet who will come after him.'

Prophet Zakariya was overjoyed and asked, 'How can I have a son when I am so old and my wife is barren?' The angel replied, 'With Allah, all things are possible. He will give you a sign. You will not be able to speak for three days, but when you come out of your silence, you will bear witness that Allah is the one who has power over all things.'

And so it happened. Prophet Zakariya was unable to speak for three days, and when he did regain his speech, he praised Allah and said, 'Allah is my Lord, and I have never disobeyed Him. Whenever He commanded me, I was always ready to obey. And I pray to my Lord to forgive me and my parents, and to accept my prayer, for Allah is the most merciful of all.'

And Ahmad, do you know what happened next? Prophet Zakariya's wife gave birth to a beautiful and healthy baby boy, and they named him Yahya, just as the angel had commanded. And Yahya grew up to be a righteous and pious man, just as the angel had promised."

Ahmad looked up at his mother with wide eyes. "So, mother, if we pray to Allah with a pure heart, He will always listen to us and grant us our wishes?"

His mother nodded and said, "Yes, my dear Ahmad. But remember, Allah knows what is best for us, and sometimes, what we want is not always what is best for us. So, even if we don't always get what we ask for, we must trust that Allah's plan for us is always for our own good. And always remember to be grateful for all the blessings that Allah has given us, just like Prophet Zakariya and his wife were."

Ahmad nodded, feeling comforted and at peace. He thanked his mother for the story and snuggled closer to her as she tucked him in. And with a heart full of gratitude and a mind full of the wonders of Allah, Ahmad drifted off to sleep, ready to face another day of being a kind and curious Muslim boy.

And so, my dear son, always remember that Allah is always listening to your prayers, and be grateful for all the blessings that He has given you. And may you have sweet dreams and a peaceful night's rest, just like Ahmad. Ameen.
